page.title: 01INTRODUCING STOURBRIDGE
page.content: {Stourbridge}is in the south west corner of the Metropolitan Borough of Dudley,and the most south westerly point of the West Midlands conurbation.It represents the{service} centre for the districts of Pedmore, Lye,Amblecote and Wollaston and as a {commuter}zone to the centres of Birmingham and Wolverhampton. Traditional industries such as chain and nail making,the wool trade and other manufacturing industries developed and were aided by the availability of raw materials.The establishment of canals and railways allowed accessibility to markets elsewhere for the end products. Today new{industry}has developed along the valley of the River Stour outside the central business district which is confined by the ring road.
